title: I appreciate Riot Tantram.
body:
I am always happy to read a Tantram comment when I see one pop up on the Red Tracker.   He/she handles these boards with far more patience than I do and typically provides enough feedback to put a case to rest on the boards.

TLDR:  Thanks for participating on the boards, Tantram.

Pfft...All the negative threads are from adolescent bedwetters...

These Reds are just doing normal stuff anyone else would do...Hell, minus this thread, I never see 'em anyways so I dunno how they get any hate at all...

I was banned, haven't particularly been enjoying trying to level my new account, have been quite down about all of it, and yet even I still appreciate the reds who post here.

It's the people who refuse to accept their own faults that I have little patience for.

...Tantram. TanTRAM.

Honestly, I almost thought this was a hate thread at first. Glad I thought wrong.

My ability to spell is sub par but luckily not report worthy. :)

There have been an inordinate of negative posts the last week or so and I've been finding myself responding more and more tersely.  So I figured, It might be good for me just to make a positive post.    

The people who work are Riot are people.  They are gamers who come from as diverse a background as all of us.  To bash  them and their work (going beyond mere criticism) is just a bit unfair in my book.  And considering I live mostly in the Player Behavior & Moderation boards, I view Tantram as my Riot-based patronus and thus the one I wanted to praise.
You the type of person I'm glad to run across

I dislike Tantram. Recently when I was permabanned he refused to give me even the slightest bit of insight as to what was going on and instead gave me the run-around. I would have preferred to be {{summoner:11}} 'd over being ignored. It was terrifying have no chat logs and zero information as to why I was even banned in the first place, this is especially egregious because I've seen him do exactly what I asked him to do with me for others many many times. 

And he **WAS** online. He **DID** see my thread. **I can 100% confirm that he knew exactly what I was going through**, he knew exactly what had happened with my account but willingly, of his own volition,  withheld vital information. I find that to be abhorrent given his role in the community and the company. I didn't ask for special favors or abuse of power... I just wanted to know wtf was going on and he completely dismissed me, having zero interest or care in the world. He deliberately went out of his way to NOT assist me in the slightest.... I cannot feel anything positive for such a person... as to why he would do such a thing, single me out in such a way... I cannot say but it doesn't matter, actions speak louder than words.

That being said; The person that did help (Riot Sharky) is divine and I wish him the best. 

It would be funny if it turns out that the Riot behavior guys were all in agreement as to permabanning me and Tantram specifically told them not to (Possibly because he see's me post on his board subsection regularly) , advocating for my un-banning as the sole defender of a player he considered to have been mistreated/subjected to an abortion of justice.... if that happened I blamed Tantram, I'd look like a complete jackass... but I'm fairly confident that is not the case.

(Inb4 re-permaban for criticizing a Riot employee)

I think you're incorrectly taking your frustration out on the most visible Riot member in this board. He participates in these boards voluntarily and not as part of his job responsibility at Riot.  He could very easily not respond to ANY posts and wouldn't be doing anything wrong regarding I'd job duties.

> [{quoted}](name=Firu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9ue5E2oa,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2016-05-21T04:00:42.765+0000)
>
> I think you're incorrectly taking your frustration out on the most visible Riot member in this board.

How so? I didn't actively say anything negative about him but rather relayed the facts and stated that I dislike him.  That's hardly "taking out my frustration (on him)".

(I.e. it wasn't "LOL EFF THIS DUDE" but rather "Here a summary of what happened; I dislike him because of that")

>He participates in these boards voluntarily and not as part of his job responsibility at Riot. 

Correct... and yet he singled me out , specifically and very deliberately, as someone he would actively NOT aid. I am not saying he did a bad job, nor am I saying he did anything actively wrong but it is impossible for me to have a positive opinion of him. 

>He could very easily not respond to ANY posts and wouldn't be doing anything wrong regarding I'd job duties.

Yes, yes he could but he doesn't.

He responds to many people and I've seen him {{summoner:11}}  TONS of people.... I would have been perfectly fine with that and yet I was completely ignored/dismissed. To reiterate yet again; It wasn't being perma-banned that was so horrible, it's happened before... it was the _** being deliberately kept in the dark **_ part that was horrible. People that I know participated in that are, in my mind, never going to win me back.

It's true, you didn't curse him out and act toxic.  It's just that, when I read your post, it was a bit beyond just stating the facts.  You assigned intentionality to a person's actions (or lack of action) that I think wasn't there.  Then, after that, you built a case to support that previous intentionality.  What you did wasn't like "punishable" or "reportable" by any means.  You're frustrated and we're just talking.  That's all.

-------

By this argument, every person a Rioter does not respond to is being "singled out".  There are dozens of "unban me" posts made in the boards every day as you know.  Is Riot singling out each one that they _don't_ respond to? I don't think so.  I think it is more likely that Rioters are busy doing their job.  When they check the boards, they are just logging on quickly and responding to whatever they see immediately and can be handled quickly.  

And once again, they do this because they want to (responding on boards) not because they have to.

Your case was probably complicated.  Rioters who read the boards either didn't catch it in the multitude of posts made here by other players or they thought it was too complicated to handle quickly and publicly.  But Riot did eventually handled it.  These issues aren't the cause or the responsibility of just one Rioter but the entire team.

--------

I understand your frustration at having been banned and the process taking a few days to resolve.  I just think you're misdirected in your outlet for it.  Also, I really do appreciate your constant efforts to reform.  As an outside observer though, it's not these particular comments that have me worried for you.  It's the rationale behind them.  


I don't want you to get banned again, accidentally or otherwise.  The way I see to help you is to just try and help you understand if your frustration is earned (here it is, I think) and if your responses to it are appropriate (I think singling out one Rioter when a group of Rioters handle these things together is not).

----

And the last bit, things may feel personal (such as not getting an answer immediately) but they often times are not.  There are so many other factors that go into play.  Try to view it from the other party's perspective.  For instance, take a moment and try to put yourself in Tantram's shoes.  If you were Riot Tantram, what might be some reasons why you didn't respond to one post, out of many, regarding an issue you and the rest of the Player Behavior team were probably already working?  I can think of far more benign and understandable reasons than I can cruel and mean ones.

> [{quoted}](name=Firu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9ue5E2oa,comment-id=000a000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-21T14:36:13.609+0000)
>
>frustrated and we're just talking.  That's all.

Nope, you are incorrect.

I did a cold, dispassionate breakdown of what occurred.  That is not the same as what you are falsely claiming.

> By this argument, every person a Rioter does not respond to is being "singled out"

Except we know for a fact that Tantram knew about my case and specifically opted NOT to assist me. That's not the same as simply 'not responding'.

> There are dozens of "unban me" posts made in the boards every day as you know. 

Was my thread "Unban me"?
No.

> Your case was probably complicated.

I wasn't asking for a resolution I was asking for information.

These are not the same thing.

> I understand your frustration at having been banned and the process taking a few days to resolve.  I just think you're misdirected in your outlet for it.

Once again, you are projecting.

Making a dispassionate breakdown of what occurred is not 'taking it out' on someone.

> things may feel personal (such as not getting an answer immediately) but they often times are not. 

For the Nth time; We know , specifically in this case that Tantram opted NOT to assist me.

That is the difference. You are acting as if I am looking for someone to blame and randomly selected Riot Tantram, that is not the case. He knew exactly what was going on and singled me out as someone he would not provide information to.  It's not complicated.

And (yet again), I am not saying anything ill about Riot Tantram, it is not his job to assist people in the way that I wanted , however, being singled out as someone he chose not to assist leaves me with the impossibility of ever viewing him in a positive light. That is not wrong.

This is my last comment on this because I feel like we're just running in circles now.

You did not make a cold and dispassionate claim.  I'm not saying you were wrong to post what you did, I'm just saying it wasn't as neutral in tone as you think it was.  See the below from your original post.  You're making a lot of assumptions on Tantram's intent.  I bolded the parts that I believe were these assumptions.

> ....he knew exactly what had happened with my account **_but willingly, of his own volition,_** withheld vital information. I find that to be abhorrent given his role in the community and the company. I didn't ask for special favors or abuse of power... I just wanted to know wtf was going on and** _he completely dismissed me, having zero interest or care in the world_**. 


------------------
I also think you're incorrect in assuming you were singled out.  You were one of quite a few people who did not receive any response from Riot regarding the issue (on the message boards).  You did receive a response from Riot via your ticket and email.

In my opinion regarding this issue, you were not singled out by anyone.  You received the same exact treatment as the majority of players who were incorrectly banned under that mistake.  By constantly implying that you deserved a response (here on the boards, from Tantram or anyone at Riot) you sound like you were demanding some special treatment (i.e., a Red Post specific to you).


--------------

Your situation was a mistake by Riot.  Riot handled it as best as they could.  In fact, I would think you deserve some sort of compensation (like an IP boost or mystery skin) for being incorrectly flagged if you're completely innocent.  However, I think you're incorrect of your assessment about how one particular Rioter did (or did not) handle your specific case.

>
> You did not make a cold and dispassionate claim.

Yes I did.  You can argue otherwise but the evidence does not line up with your false claim. I did not flame, nor did I even speak ill of this person I simply explained.
